item.title: Create Github repository from command line using shell script
item.description: Welcome to my second post. In this post, we will see how to create a new Github repository from command line/terminal using shell script (bash to be precisely) in Linux. My OS is Ubuntu 16.04 LTS and I’ve tested the script on Linux Mint as well (Linux Mint is created on top of Ubuntu). Since last night, I’m struggling hard to automate build and deployment of my Hugo website in a very simple fashion using bash script.

item.title: My first post
item.description: WELCOME This is my first Post + Blog. Just now setup with Hugo and hosted on Github pages. Please do come back when I’ve written something worth your time. Thanks üòÑ

item.title: About
item.description: Hello everyone ! My name is Abhinav Rahul. I’m a web developer from India. Playing with web technologies & knowing recent trends in cloud, devops etc. are my favourite pastimes. Feel free to reach out to me via email if you’ve any queries.

item.title: Home
item.description: Hi ! Welcome to IndusOcean, my blog. Here, I’ll be sharing information on web development & recent technology related stuff that interests me. Click for more details about me.
